member.name: T:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerControlIDConverter
member.summary: Provides a type converter that retrieves a list of control IDs in the current container.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerControlIDConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerControlIDConverter.GetStandardValues(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: Returns a collection of control IDs from the container in the object when provided with a format context.
member.returns: An object that holds a set of strings that represent the control IDs of the controls in the current container. If the container has no controls, returns an empty collection. If the context is null or if there is no current container, returns null.
member.param: An object that provides a format context that can be used to extract additional information about the environment from which this converter is invoked. This parameter, or properties of this parameter, can be null.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerControlIDConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the collection of standard values that is returned from the method is an exclusive list of possible values, by using the specified context.
member.returns: true if the object that is returned from the method provides an exhaustive list of possible values; false if other values are possible. The default is false
member.param: An object that provides a format context.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerControlIDConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this converter supports a standard set of control IDs that can be picked from a list, by using the specified context.
member.returns: true if the method should be called to find a common set of control IDs that the object supports; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.param: An object that provides a format context.

member.name: T:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerEventNameConverter
member.summary: Provides a type converter that retrieves a list of events for a control in the current container.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerEventNameConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerEventNameConverter.GetStandardValues(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: Returns a collection of event names for a control in the container in the instance for a specified format context.
member.returns: A collection of strings that represent the event names of a control in the current container. If no controls are currently contained, the method returns an empty collection. If the context is null or if there is no current container, the method returns null.
member.param: A format context object that can be used for more information about the environment that this converter is invoked from. This parameter or its properties can be null.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerEventNameConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the collection of standard values that is returned from is an exclusive list of possible values for the specified context.
member.returns: true if the returned from is an exhaustive list of possible values; false if other values are possible. The default implementation returns false.
member.param: The format context.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.AsyncPostBackTriggerEventNameConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether this converter supports a standard set of control event names that can be selected from a list.
member.returns: true if should be called to find a common set of control ID values that the object supports; otherwise, false. The default implementation returns true.
member.param: The format context.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified collection type.
member.param: The type of the collection to be edited.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.CollectionEditorBase.CreateCollectionForm
member.summary: Creates a new form to display and edit the current collection.
member.returns: The object to provide as the user interface for editing the collection.

member.name: M:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.LinqDesignerDataSourceView.GetDesignTimeData(System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets the design-time data that matches the schema of the associated data source control by using the specified number of rows. Returns a value that indicates whether the data is sample or real data.
member.returns: The data to display at design time.
member.param: The minimum number of rows to return.
true to indicate that the returned data is sample data; false to indicate that the returned data is live data.

member.name: P:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl

member.returns: true in all cases.
